revised_title: Assessment and Medical Significance of Marine Pollution by Organic Chemicals
tldr: This article discusses the medical significance of marine pollution by organic chemicals, focusing on the persistence of pollutants in saltwater, bioaccumulation in marine food, and localized pollution of sea shores. The author highlights the importance of understanding the toxicological information and biological data to assess the health hazards posed by pollutants such as organochlorine compounds, polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons, and organomercury compounds.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Pollution and Waste Management
